## Protocol for the Spectral Digitization of Herbarium Specimens

**CURRENT VERSION: {{< var protocol_version >}}**

Navigate to [Changes Since Last Version](protocol/changes.qmd)

---

Herbarium specimens are an unparalleled record of plant diversity that we can leverage via reflectance spectroscopy to illuminate plant biology across time, space, and taxa. 

The **IHerbSpec Protocol** was developed to provide clear, community-driven standards for spectral measurement and metadata documentation‚Äîestablishing best practices to minimize technical errors, maximize data quality, and promote transparency in accordance with the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable ([FAIR](https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2016.18)) principles.

By following this protocol, researchers and collections can generate reproducible, interoperable data that support confident aggregation across institutions and unlock new insights in ecology, evolution, and biodiversity sciences.

## üì• Download IHerbSpec Protocol Files

**Versioned releases of the IHerbSpec Protocol are archived on Zenodo:**  [![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.18451589.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18451589)

Each archived release includes:
- A compiled PDF of the full protocol (stable, citable snapshot)
- Protocol source files (Quarto/Markdown and associated assets) for transparency and reproducibility
- Metadata templates and controlled vocabularies (CSV files)
- Optional rendered HTML files corresponding to the archived version

The website presents the most current living version of the protocol, while Zenodo preserves fixed, citable versions for reference, reuse, and long-term archiving.

## üë• Get Involved
::: {.column-page-inset}
<div class="content-narrow">

This protocol reflects a team science approach. We welcome comments and invite people interested in spectroscopy and preserved plants and fungi to join IHerbSpec and  contribute to our activities.  

### Join the IHerbSpec community

To get announcements and participate in our activities, [Contact Us](https://iherbspec.github.io/contact) or join our **IHerbSpec-all** Google Group by following these instructions:

1) Visit [groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-all](https://groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-all), 
2) click *Ask to join group*, and (optionally) send a brief message to introduce yourself.
3) To participate in protocol discussions, repeat steps 1 and 2 for the Protocol group also: [groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-protocol](https://groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-protocol)  

### Questions and Discussion Forums

IHerbSpec maintains multiple **public communication channels** to support dialogue, transparency, and discovery across the community. You can browse previously discussed topics and ask questions through the following forums:

- **IHerbSpec-Protocol Google Group**
  - Public protocol discussion, clarification, and governance
  - [https://groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-protocol](https://groups.google.com/u/4/a/g.harvard.edu/g/iherbspec-protocol)

- **GitHub Discussions**
  - Public Q&A and ideas related to IHerbSpec and the IHerbSpec Protocol
  - [https://github.com/IHerbSpec/iherbspec.github.io/discussions](https://github.com/IHerbSpec/iherbspec.github.io/discussions)

- **GitHub Issues**
  - Concrete, actionable proposed edits or technical tasks related to the website or protocol source  
  - [https://github.com/IHerbSpec/iherbspec.github.io/issues](https://github.com/IHerbSpec/iherbspec.github.io/issues)
